intro: Ismene calathiformis, commonly known as the basket-leaved ismene, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features palmate leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern, giving it a unique and ornamental appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ismene calathiformis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
